meta.dc:title: Title 42 - The Public Health And Welfare

subchapter.heading: HEALTH INSURANCE FOR AGED AND DISABLED

section.heading: Prohibition against any Federal interference
section.content: Nothing in this subchapter shall be construed to authorize any Federal officer or employee to exercise any supervision or control over the practice of medicine.

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: The insurance program established by this subchapter shall not apply to any individual.

subsection.heading: Exceptions
subsection.content: Subsection (a) shall not apply in the case of-

paragraph.content: an individual who is entitled to benefits under part A, or
an individual who is enrolled under part B.

section.heading: Free choice by patient guaranteed
section.content: Any individual entitled to insurance benefits under this subchapter may obtain health services from any institution, agency, or person qualified to participate.

subsection.heading: Basic rule
subsection.content: Subject to the provisions of this section, any individual may choose any qualified provider.

section.heading: Declaration of policy
section.content: It is the policy of the United States to promote the general welfare of the Nation.
